replies.author: @pistonburner6448
replies.text:
@Fixti0n That, and Scandinavian people are not a mix of people who have often fled their home countries, been outcasts looking to find a place in a new country. Scandinavians have very long-established societies which they live in. Far less geographical mobility. They've simply had a much higher imperative and incentive to settle down and 'find their place in society'. In the USA there has been strong incentive to do the opposite: if they engage in criminality they have massive opportunities to move around to new areas, no strong societal pressure to settle down in small close-knit communities.
In Scandinavia opportunity for crime is also lower: less history of organised crime, far less history of out of control criminality like in the USA. That has led to people committing crimes to be sought after with more resources, more effort, and people being less willing to let criminality become a normal phenomenon as they feel "their village" has been violated. They don't consider it just a small 'business expense' which can be sidestepped like is often seen in the more dynamic, upward-mobile USA.

replies.author: @Nitsirtriscuit
replies.text: Think of it in a slightly different perspective, not that poverty causes an individual to become a criminal, instead that poverty causes an individual to be victimized more easily. It is easier and more lucrative for criminals to steal, deal, and fight in poor communities where the average person can't afford high fences, personal space, cameras, or police attention. It also requires a certain level of wealth and affluence to commit white collar crimes in the first place, so there is a nearly bimodal divide between what types of crime are possible for an income bracket. When a wealthy person does murder someone, they do it so well they are never suspected or bribe the investigation away. Wealthy people do steal from poor people, but they do it by wage theft, not by pickpocketing or breaking in. It's harder to notice and harder to prove. Poverty causes a certain group of crimes to be way more prevalent and acted out by a rudimentary generalized group of people. Kinda like how if a chicken coop has hole in the wall it doesn't cause the chickens to cannibalize, it just lets the weasels in. Meanwhile, the farmer steals the eggs but the chickens don't notice cause they don't wake up dead.
